title: Add Command
objective: Learn how to define a command with a parameter using Electronic Data Sheets and how to
define and dispatch a command handler function.

exercise.instructions:
1. Locate the '<DataTypeSet>' element.
2. Within this element create a new 'ContainerDataType':
    Named 'ExampleParamCmd_Payload'
    EntryList entry named 'Param' with type 'BASE_TYPES/uint16'

Note BASE_TYPES is defined in cfe/modules/core_api/eds/base_types.xml

1. Locate the 'ResetCountersCmd' ContainerDataType.
2. After this entry create a new 'ContainerDataType':
    Named 'ExampleParamCmd'
    FunctionCode value of '2'
    EntryList entry named 'Payload' with type 'ExampleParamCmd_Payload'

Note the GUI needs to be restarted after building the new lesson cFS target.
Read the exercise comment block. There are no code changes for this exercise.

1. At the end of the event message identifier list add:
    #define @TEMPLATE@_EXAMPLE_PARAM_CMD_INF_EID 8

Note this is the event ID for the event message sent when the command is processed.
Note Basecamp does not recommend the '_INF' substring convention in NASA's Sample App. If the SendEvent() event type changes then the macro string also needs to change.
Read the exercise comment block. There are no code changes for this exercise.

1. In function @TEMPLATE@_ProcessGroundCommand() after the case statement for @TEMPLATE@_RESET_COUNTERS_CC add
    The @TEMPLATE@_EXAMPLE_PARAM_CC case statement code from the exercise window

1. After the NASA_WORLD_ResetCounters() command fucntion add
    The @TEMPLATE@_ExampleParamCmd() code from the exercise window

    Note this file location was chosen because it keeps the command functions together.
